result_list.explanation: Triomphalement. (Triumphantly) This indicates a manner of delivery, expressing triumph or enthusiasm.
Elle reçoit son billet. (She receives her ticket) This involves the interaction with an object, specifically receiving an item.
À Antenor. (To Antenor) This indicates the addressee of a speech.

D'Orfeuil est resté un moment étourdi de sa chute ; il se relève. (D'Orfeuil remains momentarily stunned by his fall; he gets up) This describes a general action of falling and getting up, which does not fit into other categories.
result_list.stgdir: D'Orfeuil est resté un moment étourdi de sa chute ; il se relève.

result_list.explanation: Il va se mettre entre Damis et Marthon. (He goes to stand between Damis and Marthon) This indicates a movement to a specific position on the stage.
result_list.stgdir: Il va se mettre entre Damis et Marthon.

result_list.explanation: Avisant l'Infant. (Noticing the Infant) This indicates a non-verbal interaction, specifically noticing someone.
Ici recommence la symphonie, et Joad aussitôt reprend la parole. (Here the symphony starts again, and Joad immediately speaks) This describes the music starting again.
result_list.stgdir: Ici recommence la symphonie, et Joad aussitôt reprend la parole.

result_list.explanation: Il lui remet Sophie entre les bras. (He hands Sophie over to him) This involves the interaction with an object, specifically handing over a person (Sophie).
result_list.stgdir: Il lui remet Sophie entre les bras.

result_list.explanation: Parlant à Ninon. (Speaking to Ninon) This indicates the addressee of a speech.
Air de PLANTADE. (Tune of PLANTADE) This describes a specific tune or music element.
